title: New Akali is the end of League of Legends for me.
body: Mobility creep out the ass. Damage creep out the ass. The most anti-fun, zero counterplay ability in true invisibility. The fact that you guys let this champ go live just means you want this game to die.

> [{quoted}](name=Sona Ping,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=0tKJycAJ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-08-04T01:51:16.215+0000)
>
> I wonder how that's the case when she doesn't have more dashes and doesn't have true invisibility.

Her dashes are ground-target now, giving her much more mobility when it comes to escaping and catching targets from outside of her old ult range. The one thing that was characteristic of Akali was that she could stick super hard but once she was in she had almost no way out. Now that's gone, removing her one glaring weakness.

Oh and she got a fucking stun, because every AP assassin needs a stun. God forbid we release a champion or rework without a stun.

She lost a dash with her rework. She went down from 4 to 3, and put 2 of them on a *hefty* cooldown.

Damage creep is...honestly debatable. She definitely has too much damage with her passive late-game (can easily pass 1k damage with Lich Bane), but that can be fixed.

Her shroud is only zero-counterplay if you're **already** a zero-counterplay champion completely reliant on point and click damage. Pick someone with a skillshot and you *will* have something you can do. :3
Pick something with a skillshot and you will get to spray it into oblivion and hope that you hit her with it but probably not LOLOLOLOL! Yep, great design!

Or you wait for her to pop out of her shroud to attack (or just wait out the shroud), you hit her with CC, then slam more skillshots into her.

Also, {{item:3364}} reveals her in it.

Oh you wait for that .04 seconds you have to hit her popping out of stealth before she kills you. Got it, so all the counterplay relies on you being about 1000x better than her while her killing you takes almost no thought.

What worries me is now she only needs half her kit (not even her ult) to kill an adc or mage.

All you have to do is W near a target, set up a E so that you get that auto 30 Energy recovery, and then E back in, Q, get in a couple autos, and your target is dead.

And Champs who can punish her in stealth like {{champion:43}} are where she unfortunately uses her ult, which ...... even if you dodged 70% of her kit, the R will enable her to make up for it, by stunning you, Qing more, and then if she needs to, R again to get out.

Personally I think she's VERY much like Yasuo: People will generally suck at playing her for about 3-4 months. And..... then they will learn how to reposition 3 times within 2 seconds, and use 2 of those to enable a kill, and still have some kit left.

Her biggest gating feature is her Energy requiring her to cross that circle or just burn free energy on minions. Once players start to play her aggressively and E champs over and over, she will no longer find herself gated and people will purely hate her more than the old Akali.

And then teams will begin to design themselves to fight her...... going aoe nuke after aoe nuke, and then the resulting teams breeding in dueling/mobility weakness will begin to get countered by more comprehensive champs, kind of like {{champion:11}} does.
She has less mobility and her burst is severely delayed. But please, tell me again about this "mobility creep" and "damage creep".

I've been playing Akali so much since she was on the PBE, here are some tips to remember when going against her:
1.  Avoid her W, predicting where she is at when she's in her shroud is really hard. It's better to just avoid it if you can.
2.  If she hits you with Q step back for a second, she will most likely hit you with a passive auto if you get to close again.
3.  After she uses her first R that's your time-frame to use spells on her before she uses her second R, do this to quickly to avoid her dodging your spells with her second R
4.  If she hits you with an E and she recasts it, you can flash back into your team or your tower to put her out of place. She will have to use flash or her ult to try to get out of her E.
